name: sfchronicle
text:
In her normal, pre-pandemic life, UCSF’s Dr. Maria Raven liked to unwind on a Saturday night by whipping up a Mediterranean-inspired dinner for 20. 

Here’s how she’s adapting to the pandemic: https://t.co/HEQfbsH2Ai

name: sfchronicle
text: The California Legislature has less than a month left in its pandemic-shortened session to deal with one of the state’s worst economic crises in decades, and there’s no greater emergency than what to do about the rent. https://t.co/YlTGTiaNtV

name: sfchronicle
text:
How California reduced its inmate population to a 30-year low.

Story by @BobEgelko: https://t.co/i0e9Lwj7Wt

name: sfchronicle
text: Some are elaborately built. Others look flimsy. As S.F. restaurants take over parking spaces for outdoor dining, @JohnKingSFChron weighs in on urban design for the pandemic age. https://t.co/hhW1VEnqe2

name: sfchronicle
text: “I used to get tormented a little bit,” Toney said. “Black kids in my neighborhood would say, ‘What are you doing? We don’t play golf.’ And white kids at the course would say, ‘You don’t belong out here.’ All that did was motivate me more.” https://t.co/h26pI1oPLD

name: sfchronicle
text: As a pandemic playbook has emerged for moving, working and socializing remotely in the Bay Area, new ways to make friends have also grown organically out of the disruption caused by the coronavirus. https://t.co/GHMcGCvfJC

name: sfchronicle
text: Several bills are moving through the Legislature to prevent what many worry could be a wave of evictions. But landlord groups and tenant advocates are divided. https://t.co/5dsXhm1Zu4

name: sfchronicle
text: Dining in the Bay Area has changed during the pandemic thanks to automation. But it’s looking more like the technology isn’t just a temporary fix, and will continue to grow long after the pandemic comes to an end. https://t.co/CkmqCOwnhr

name: sfchronicle
text: Health vetting, risk assessment, masked erotica and going virtual. Here's how relationships, new and old, are changing in the pandemic: https://t.co/G71hQXI862
